page.title: 16THE LITTLEPORT BY-PASS
page.content: The{by-pass}to take traffic round Ely and Littleport was announced in 1983, the cost has risen from Â£3,7000,000 to Â£7,250,000 due to the raw materials and it is to be finished in 1986. Traffic going between Kings Lynn, Cambridge and London on the{A10 trunk {road}clog up the narrow roads of Littleport and Ely at present. Three alternative routes were offered and the one chosen avoids passing over subsiding fen soil and involves no demolition of property. It passes from Ely to the West and North of the village, meeting the A10 again at the new Littleport Bridge over the river. It will make{traffic}lighter in Littleport, reduce the{accident rate and{noise levels. A new by-pass and no secondary school, both in 1986, will make Littleport much quieter!
